body:
i just noticed that this must've something to do with permissions.
if oc has write permissions in the external storage folder a file gets put in the trashbin correctly but as soon as i add a local storage where oc has no write-permissions the trashbin no longer works.
edit:
upon further investigation i noticed that write permissions don't seem to make any difference as i just changed them for the folder in question. it's just one specific folder that causes the problem if it gets mounted in oc. no idea why this is happening.. the folder in question has many subfolders and holds around 800gb of data, could this be related?
edit2:
not adding the subfolder directly but the rootfolder where the folder in question resides allows me to use the trashbin-function.. so if nobody else is having this issue i guess i can live with this workaround ;)

@jps24 thanks for your detailed bug report and for further testing. sounds quite strange. the trash bin app doesn't distinguish between any storage so it should work independent from it. of course the web server needs sufficient permissions to access the mounted folder. in case of the trash bin read permission should be enough to copy the file over to the trash folder. if owncloud doesn't have write permission to the original location files will be restored to the users root folder. but according to your tests permissions doesn't seem to be an issue here.

just a guess, but what's the name of the root folder for which the trash bin doesn't work? does it contain any special characters, spaces, etc. normally this shouldn't make any difference but at least it would be something which could be checked.

@schiesbn 
thanks for your reply! there are no special characters in the foldername but i played around a bit more and tried moving several subfolders from the directory to see if that changes something. it did not but afterwards i tried renaming the mount itself in oc's admin-ui and voilã  another mount was created that did work! after that i tried to create the mount with the original name again and now trash bin works with that as well. i don't quite understand the logic behind that but i'm  really happy it's working now! ;)
